stories.text:
Hi,

We're exploring the idea of managing our product roadmap with git issues.

I'm looking for example of companies doing so. I have the following in mind:

* Gitlab (https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-com/-/issues)

* SimpleAnalytics (https://github.com/orgs/simpleanalytics/projects/1#card-52073682)

Do you have other examples/resources/feedback to get inspiration and examples from?
stories.title: Startups using git issues to manage their roadmap?
Unreliable renewables are forcing California to scramble for electricity

stories.text:
It's obviously won't work for everyone, but after being thoroughly frustrated with Strapi CMS last night, I realized I could write a few lambdas. With API gateway you can serve the lambda response directly, so I basically upload assets to S3, and have my first lambda return a list of those assets, and provide secondary links to access them. Then I have a couple of lambdas which will either return json data or binary assets ( signed urls so the objects aren't public ) depending on what type of asset I'm trying to get back.

It was like an eureka moment when I realized I could vastly simplify my workflow by doing this, my only concern right now is this simply won't scale. Listing hundreds of AWS bucket items does not sound like a fun time, but before I get to that I can always add something like a dynamodb table which keeps track of the items for me.

I highly recommend this approach if you're developing something like a video game and you need a quick and dirty backend for prototyping. For my project I should be the only user who actually needs to upload data, so just dropping the files directly on S3 works extremely well. I can also add a basic front end to upload the files to S3 if needed.
